info.headline: Wind Advisory issued November 25 at 3:26AM HST until November 25 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST TODAY FOR A PORTION OF THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS... .Winds have begun to weaken some, however locally strong and gusty winds continue today across the typical windier locations, such as mountain ridges or leeward areas prone to gusty winds. Winds are expected to drop below advisory threshold later this afternoon and evening. ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST TODAY... * WHAT...Northeast winds 25 to 35 mph with localized gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Kauai, Oahu, Lanai, Kahoolawe, Maui and the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST today. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can tear off shingles, knock down tree branches, blow away tents and awnings and make driving difficult, especially for drivers of high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Watch out for falling tree branches when walking or driving. Make sure tents and awnings are secure or take them down. Be prepared for power outages.
